comment:
Single Temperature Infusion - The Starch Conversion/Saccharification Rest
Mashing about 153°F. A lower mash temperature, less than or equal to 150°F, yields a thinner bodied, drier beer. A higher mash temperature, greater than or equal to 156°F, yields a less fermentable, sweeter beer.
With BRY-97 hopps seemed to lose aroma before full carbonation. Also, yeast, it is slows starter. Recommendation: Use blow off tube
